meanings.definition: Superlative form of the adjective 'forte', meaning very loud or strong in music.
meanings.sent1: The orchestra played fortissimi, making the audience cover their ears.
meanings.sent2: In the concert, the fortissimi notes resonated throughout the hall.
meanings.sent3: The fortissimi sound of the drums startled the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent4: Her fortissimi determination to succeed was like a roaring thunderstorm.
meanings.sent5: The fortissimi sound of the thunder made the ground tremble.

meanings.definition: Plural form of the noun 'fortissimo', referring to the loudest dynamic level in music.
meanings.sent1: The music piece ended with powerful fortissimi from the entire orchestra.
meanings.sent2: The fortissimi in the symphony added an intense climax to the performance.
meanings.sent3: The fortissimi of the trumpets made the audience jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The fortissimi of the storm outside matched the intensity of the music.
meanings.sent5: The fortissimi of the choir echoed through the grand hall.
